message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel state-space approach to perform dynamic nonnegative matrix factorization (D-NMF) and uses expectation maximization to estimate the basis matrix and the N-VAR model parameters. The paper also compares the proposed approach with two state-of-the-art NMF approaches that exploit temporal dependencies. Based on this, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper proposes a new algorithm for NMF and compares it with existing approaches. Other likely sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as the paper proposes a probabilistic framework and uses a multi-lag nonnegative vector autoregressive (N-VAR) model. The paper also uses a maximum a posteriori estimate of the state variables, which could fall under cs.IT (Information Theory) or cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
